author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is trying to bring together its former allies in the State, which faced the 2014 Lok Sabha elections together, the party’s State president Tamilisai Soundararajan said here on Sunday.

Sidelined

Calling the DMK–Congress alliance as one that has been sidelined by the people, she said the People’s Welfare Front was also a weak alliance. Ms. Tamilisai said that there was nothing wrong in DMDK leader Vijayakant aspiring to be the ‘king’ and not the ‘kingmaker’.

The BJP leader claimed that despite a drastic increase in power consumption there was no power shortage in the State as the Union Government had allotted a major portion of power from the national grid to the southern States.

She added that ‘Make in India’ will promote entrepreneurship among youth in various fields.

Ms. Soundararajan expressed disappointment over the Tamil Nadu Government not announcing prohibition in the State during the budget.

‘There is nothing wrong in Vijayakant aspiring to be the king and not the kingmaker’
title: BJP trying to bring together former allies
